poem:
"Reality in Calais Unraveled"

The seagulls awash 
in the port of Calais,
tangled web of humanity --
striving and desperate. 

Nineteen hearts,
string-pulled puppeteers,
uprooted, silenced.

Guardians from triple lands,
uprising with the sun,
like a wave washing over
the sand marked paths.

Gang-felled,
by hands extending from the unseen,
a symphony of justice
echoes in the quiet aftermath.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Calais people-smuggling gang broken up with 19 arrests, says Europol One of the most active and largest people-smuggling gangs operating in Calais has been dismantled with 19 “high-value targets” arrested by German, French and Belgian police after a year-long investigation, Europol has announced. Operation Task Force Wave, involving 600 police, arrested the leader of the Iraqi Kurdish gang and five of the main organisers in Germany where the people-smuggling operation was orchestrated, police said. The". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
